ioformat

Class IOARFF

  • java.lang.Object
    • ioformat.IOARFF

  • public class IOARFF
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that implements methods for data load and persistence to and from the ARFF data format, as used in Weka (for cross-compatibility). The details of the format can be accessed at the following link: http://www.cs.waikato.ac.nz/~ml/weka/arff.html It should be noted, though, that this library uses a different sparse ARFF data format, so sparse and combined dense+sparse data would have to be transformed prior to external usage.

        public BOWDataSet loadSparseCategoryLast(java.lang.String inPath)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads a sparse data representation. This is one of the two supported variants of the same format, where the last attribute is interpreted as class attribute.
        Parameters:
        inPath - String that is the path to the input file.
        Returns:
        BOWDataSet that is the sparse dataset object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • loadSparse

        public BOWDataSet loadSparse(java.io.BufferedReader br,
                    java.lang.String classAttName)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads a sparse data representation. This is one of the two supported variants of the same format, where the class information does not need to be given as last.
        Parameters:
        br - BufferedReader to read the data from.
        classAttName - String that is the class attribute name.
        Returns:
        BOWDataSet that is the sparse dataset object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
